snippet.textDisplay:
From favorite to least favorite, I'd go: 3, 6, 2, 5, 4, 1.
I'd put a pretty huge gap between the first and last three, though. 3, 6, and 2 are significantly better imo.
snippet.textOriginal:
From favorite to least favorite, I'd go: 3, 6, 2, 5, 4, 1.
I'd put a pretty huge gap between the first and last three, though. 3, 6, and 2 are significantly better imo.

snippet.textDisplay:
@wertq1111 I also feel that your enjoyment of MMBN5 is directly related to how much you enjoy the Liberation Missions. I loved them, but, I understand why other people wouldn't like them.

Also, it seems that people liked Team Colonel more than Team Protoman. Which is understandable, because Team Colonel is way cooler even if they're worse gameplay-wise barring a couple of gamebreakers.
snippet.textOriginal:
@wertq1111 I also feel that your enjoyment of MMBN5 is directly related to how much you enjoy the Liberation Missions. I loved them, but, I understand why other people wouldn't like them.

Also, it seems that people liked Team Colonel more than Team Protoman. Which is understandable, because Team Colonel is way cooler even if they're worse gameplay-wise barring a couple of gamebreakers.

snippet.textDisplay:
@wertq1111 Same, liked 5 a lot but it wasn't my favorite. 

I did feel like 5 had some of the catchiest music, though! Whenever I heard the boss theme while playing, I just got so pumped. xD
snippet.textOriginal:
@wertq1111 Same, liked 5 a lot but it wasn't my favorite.

snippet.authorDisplayName: I'M LOOKING FOR A SPRITE SPONSORSHIP

snippet.textDisplay: @Maurice Chagall Just to clarify, I didn't dislike 5 at all. I liked it a lot, and I wouldn't have beaten it twice if I didn't. I guess that, when it comes down to it, i'm just not a huge fan of the soul unison system. It felt very limiting to me: sacrificing a chip (also meaning you only get to choose 4 chips that turn), and then getting a form that only lasts for 3 turns (and correct me if i'm wrong, but then that soul can't be used anymore in that battle), and they made it better in 5, but 4's soul unisons were pretty weak.
snippet.textOriginal: @Maurice Chagall Just to clarify, I didn't dislike 5 at all. I liked it a lot, and I wouldn't have beaten it twice if I didn't. I guess that, when it comes down to it, i'm just not a huge fan of the soul unison system. It felt very limiting to me: sacrificing a chip (also meaning you only get to choose 4 chips that turn), and then getting a form that only lasts for 3 turns (and correct me if i'm wrong, but then that soul can't be used anymore in that battle), and they made it better in 5, but 4's soul unisons were pretty weak.

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite game in the series so far, but I've yet to play 4+. I played this game quite a long time ago, so this is another series I really need to get back to. Big fan! I really like the atmosphere in these games and the battle system is one of my favorites in an RPG.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite game in the series so far, but I've yet to play 4+. I played this game quite a long time ago, so this is another series I really need to get back to. Big fan! I really like the atmosphere in these games and the battle system is one of my favorites in an RPG.

snippet.textDisplay: Have to agree, 6 was also my favorite. As for internet themes, I would say 1 and 2 probably had the best.
snippet.textOriginal: Have to agree, 6 was also my favorite. As for internet themes, I would say 1 and 2 probably had the best.

snippet.textDisplay: Battle Network 6 is by far the best game that came out after the first 3. I enjoyed it almost as much as I did 2 and 3, and it was a fantastic end to the series.
snippet.textOriginal: Battle Network 6 is by far the best game that came out after the first 3. I enjoyed it almost as much as I did 2 and 3, and it was a fantastic end to the series.

snippet.textDisplay: @TrainerAlec 4 also had a terrible music change; they tried to swap music engines along with the artstyle, and the music did not turn out well at all.
snippet.textOriginal: @TrainerAlec 4 also had a terrible music change; they tried to swap music engines along with the artstyle, and the music did not turn out well at all.

Of the last three, I actually only finished 6. Which was pretty good, it's between 6 and 2 for my favorite of the series after 3.

The song here, I might add, is also called NETWORK IS SPREADING because all the computer area songs were in capslock for 1-3, go figure.

snippet.textDisplay: My personal opinion is that 4 is amazingly bad, as it lacks a real depth or good story, 5 is debatable, 6 manages to recapture some good elements

snippet.textDisplay: 4's emotion system combined with the dark chips is really good. If you like SRPGs I'd give 5 a shot cause it has a lot of elements of one in it while still have Battle Networks combat. Avoid 6.
